Fields.DialogueText: What are you looking at, Nubian?
Do you see that harbour over there, Qubtan?
I see it. What about it?
Nothing terribly important. Natural landmarks set my imagination wandering.
I know what you mean. You get some of the best scenery on the Atlantic coasts.
Na'am, that too. Although I was thinking more function over form.
What do you mean, "function"?
Have you ever been to the Golden Horn, Qubtan?
The inlet near Istanbul, you mean? What about it?
A protected harbour just like the one we see here. There used to be a boom strung across it to keep enemy vessels out... or in. A work of strategic genius!

Fields.MenuText: If you say so.
Not that it could happen today.
And all they needed was a long enough chain. Remarkable.

Fields.DialogueText: You must look more closely, Qubtan! You never know what advantages you may find.
Not to surface ships, anyway. Submarine nets are still on the table...
Indeed! But the world turns, and such things lose their utility.
What I want to know is could this somehow be done now?
Perhaps to the odd Morgana submarines. The surface ships are probably too strong.
Not these ones...
@BATTLE
Nubian, the Morganas! We're almost caught up to them. Get to the bridge at once!
Antuzr! There remains one more thing for me to do.
Whatever it is, get it done and let's-
Try this dish, Qubtan. I have spent the whole day agonizing over it.

Fields.MenuText: Nubian, we don't have time for your cooking!
What's in it?
Needs more salt.

Fields.DialogueText: Nonsense! Once you have tasted this, it can sit while we fight.
Variations on a theme of roast beef stew, with plenty of garlic.
I suspected as much. One second longer, then!
Nubian, we're in a battlefield!
We're in our natural habitat. The apex predator knows every inch of it, and plans accordingly.
Well enough to cook a meal before a battle?
Well enough to experiment.
@BATTLE
Almost in range, Nubian. Let's go!
Won't you join me up here, Qubtan?
You're standing on the guardrail.
Indeed, I am! Balance is essential to a successful hunt. Do you lack balance?

Fields.MenuText: Was that a challenge?
No, I just prefer a deck below me.
You're going to get me killed one of these days.

Fields.DialogueText: Life is a challenge, and you must constantly rise to it.
We all have our preferences. Are we willing to carve them out of the world ourselves?
As I bear you into the fire, so may I shield you from it.
Now come on. I grow bored of towering over you.
You promise you'll hold on to-whoa!
Biltf, Qubtan, gently! Think of this rail as a flight of stairs. The only difference is the shape.
That's more or less the issue, isn't it?
There is a right way and a wrong way to go about this. Once you know the right way, failure becomes a simple matter of choice. Do you choose to fall?
No!
Hmm... the spirit is willing. We will return to this once we have dealt with these Morganas. 'Iilaa alssilah!
Oh, now you're just showing off.
One day you, too will master the backflip! Whenever you are ready, Qubtan.
Wait! Don't leave me up here!
Belles...
@BATTLE
Nubian, we're about to–
Tawqf! Do not cross that line, Qubtan!
What line? Whoa!
As you were, Sailor! Qubtan, I must ask you not to touch that tripwire.
Tripwire? Sailor, what's going on here?
Training session, sir! Two enter, one leaves!
Nubian...
I'm serious, Qubtan. A simple ring is not enough for a serious boxing match. I had to up the stakes.
How high?
As high as those charges there will blow us both if you touch the line!
You're a Belle, you can take it. My sailors are another story.
Never fear, Qubtan. I'll dismantle the whole assembly.
And not a moment too soon. Action stations... and we need to talk afterward.
@BATTLE
Explain.
It is as I told you, Qubtan. Sailor Kirkpatrick is my most promising student. I thought he could handle an extra element of danger.
This isn't like you, Nubian. You're honest, you're diligent, you have respect for the lives of your crew. Why be so reckless?
I must confess to dishonesty again, Qubtan.
More than that. Endangering all above decks, directly threatening our–
La, no, Qubtan. Dishonesty with Sailor Kirkpatrick. Those charges were unarmed.
What?
Duds. One fights all the harder with one's life on the line, Qubtan. You see it every day in Belle and in Morganas.
Then Kirkpatrick–
Did not need to know that. It is a psychological trick I sometimes use. Truth be told, I've never seen him hold his own so long against me.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry I doubted you, Nubian. Carry on.
You can't toy with the crew's lives. Stop this at once and come clean with him.
How do you know this even works?

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Qubtan. Trust me, everything I do is for our betterment.
As you wish, Qubtan, though I believe he would be better off not knowing.
I can see fear in a man's eyes. I saw fear in Kirkpatrick's. He put it to good use.
Qubtan, will you permit me the use of the galley in the near future?
Of course. You don't need permission to use your own galley, you know.
Sahyh, but I thought it best to inform you in advance. My goals for our dinner are ambitious.
Ambitious?
Once my supplies are here... I may need it for an entire week, in truth.
I appreciate the gesture, but what's this all about?
I do not wish to call it negligence on my part. Yet a hunter must provide food for her pack, and I have not yet done this.

Fields.MenuText: You're training and fighting with them. Isn't that enough?
At least let the crew help out. The more the merrier.
I'd rather have you on the battlefield than in the kitchen.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe if I were only a ship. I am a Belle, and if I can do more for the crew, I will.
I will select a team of sous-chefs this very night!
No predator may spend all its time on the hunt. I must keep the lair in order as well!
Well, we're not exactly equipped for a feast aboard this ship.
I will find what stores I can in port. The sea shall supply the rest.
We can discuss the menu after we've driven off these Morganas.
Bialttakid!
@BATTLE
Qubtan, murhba! Won't you join me in some birdwatching?
Hunting seagulls again?
Well, hunting involves watching.
I thought you'd given up using them for food.
Na'am, to feed the crew. I have decided that we need a hunting partner.
If you think you can train a seagull to hunt, be my guest.
With enough time I could train a whole flock of those sky-rats! No, Qubtan, I have my sights set on a falcon.
You think it'll have enough space aboard this ship?
My quarters will serve as a mews. I will train him here on deck.

Fields.MenuText: Got a name picked out?
Hunting is tough out here if you're not a ship.
I don't see a naval utility for falconry.

Fields.DialogueText: The world has many names for hunters and warriors. The difficulty lies in selecting just one.
The fish and seabirds manage. So shall my new friend!
It will be a stern face in a sea of monsters. That is utility enough.
Where are you going to find a falcon?
I do not yet know. We will have the crew ask during shore leave.
"We"?
You and I must share in the training of this bird, Qubtan. Do we not share command?
You're going to teach me falconry.
My soul hails from the cradle of the sport. What better teacher than I?
They say pride goes before a fall.
Worry not, Qubtan. They do not say whose.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Are you much of a gambler, Qubtan?
Why do you–
Nubian, what is that you're holding?
Be glad we did not bet on this, Qubtan. Isn't he majestic?
Where on earth did you find a falcon?
I lent one of the torpedomen some money and he found one in port! How helpful our men are...
What's that on its head?
A hood to keep him docile. He has yet to recognize me as his master.
When will that be?
Once he is used to the ship and knows me as his source of food... so I'd imagine several weeks.

Fields.MenuText: Your bird, your plan, I suppose. Just keep it hooded?
I can't have an undomesticated animal aboard.
What's his name?

Fields.DialogueText: Only when traveling, Qubtan! He mustn't be needlessly kept in darkness.
'Iihdi. I will keep a close eye on it.
I haven't decided yet, but you will be the third to know after him and me.
Animals get skittish around Morganas. You're the one who'll have to keep him under control.
That may not be so hard, Qubtan. This one seems calmer than your average beast.
Maybe it's because he has a Belle to calm him down.
It works on you, 'alays kadhilak?
That it does. Take out these Morganas and calm me down some more.
@BATTLE
(falcon makes a loud chirp!)
Halq, saghir!
Are you missing a glove?
Very funny, Qubtan! You only need the one for a falcon. It is a perch for it and armor for me.
Seems redundant if you're invulnerable.
Every profession has its uniform.
Is that... meat between your fingers?
For our new companion! Do you see him up there on that leash?
Right there. It'd certainly be a nuisance if he flew away.
It's more to keep him from hunting. If he gets his food from anyone but me, what reason has he to obey me?

Fields.MenuText: It sounds a little sad when you put it that way.
He's going to have to be let off the leash sometime.
So no feeding him from the dinner table.

Fields.DialogueText: We have been given dominion over this earth and its creatures. It is a responsibility, not a gift.
With only my deck to bring a kill down to! I remain six steps ahead of him, Qubtan.
Not if you want to break an apex predator.
Is he coming back?
He spies a Morgana, Qubtan! His horizon is further than ours.
Eamal jyd! Well spotted, little Harun!
Harun? You finally named him?
Or "Aaron," if you prefer. The brother of Moses... the Rightly Guided Caliph... even the vengeful Moor of Titus Andronicus! It is a powerful name.
It's a powerful pet.
Khati! He is a bloodthirsty hunter and you will respect him as such!
A bloodthirsty hunter that nuzzles your hand.
We all have our soft sides.
@BATTLE
Ahtars, Qubtan!
What are you talking about–whoa!
Harun, kunn hdhra!
Goodness, I can't look that much like prey.
You were simply in the wrong place at the wrong time. I do need to start getting Harun used to you, though. Here.
You're giving him to me!?
Just wear the glove for a moment. I'm right here.

Fields.MenuText: I'm going to have to pass. You're the expert.
How do I know he's not going to attack me?
Like this?

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly why you should trust my judgment.
Because he is not hungry. Wear it!
Exactly like that.
Now what?
Now you carry him around for the rest of the day until he learns to be civil.
Nubian, I have a ship to command.
You may command me and a falcon. One of us insists on it! In time, so shall the other.
And if we run into a Morgana?
Hood Harun and hope for the best.
All right, I'll be sure to–
That was not a suggestion, Qubtan. We have company!
@BATTLE
Isn't he beautiful?
You've certainly got good taste in birds of prey.
We have Torpedoman Kajiura to thank for that. She is the one who found him!
Here he comes. What do I do again?
Looks like he has a kill! Be quick, Qubtan, and get him back on the glove before he eats his fill.
Here, boy!
That poor seagull... it does not know the glory its life will feed.

Fields.MenuText: Small comfort to it.
Your bird's certainly glorious.
We're eating seagull again?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, hush. It should be honored.
Our bird, Qubtan. If you do not believe it, neither will Harun.
Not only seagull. I have a menu in mind.
Yet just imagine... prey such as this is only the beginning for our little hunter!
You're not suggesting we use him against the Morganas.
There is nothing a falcon can do that a 4.7-inch Mark XII cannot. Never rule anything out, though.
We've got Morganas headed this direction. I'd better hood him for now.
Belay that, Qubtan. I think it's time Harun knew what he was up against.
Although... give him to me, just to be certain.
@BATTLE
What's cooking? Smells great.
Seagull... it's Harun's spoils from the last hunt! Care for a taste?
Falcon leftovers?
Cured and cleaned thoroughly, Your Squeamishness.
Belles can't get food poisoning, you know. I'm not a Belle.
What doesn't kill you...

Fields.MenuText: Oh, fine. Give me that.
... Can be permanently debilitating?
What is it with Belles and danger?

Fields.DialogueText: Hunger prevails again!
With the right approach, there is no such thing. Eat!
You can't be a warship without appreciating a little risk.
It's good. What is it?
In Egypt we call it mahshi hamam. Bird with rice stuffing. Normally it uses pigeon as a base, but any fauna will do in a pinch.
Did you make enough for everyone?
When I have a whole flock of seagulls, I will have to! For now, I thought you and I would enjoy this.
Oh, for God's sake. Now!?
Morganas?
Morganas. I'll have one of the crew keep an eye on this.
@BATTLE
Vacation pictures, Qubtan?
Command sent this new dossier this morning. It's one of the Morganas that prowls this area.
My, she looks like a terror.
Calamity. She's got a habit of showing up exactly when she isn't wanted.
Don't they all?
She's racked up more kills than any other Morgana in the region.
Intriguing...
Really? I'm just reading what it says here.
My gut tells me to file away that intelligence for later, Qubtan. We may need it.

Fields.MenuText: It's still early in the war. It could just be a fluke.
Intelligence is about more than just your feelings.
Think she's got a strategy?

Fields.DialogueText: Even a fluke may be exploited.
War is deceit, Qubtan, and intuition is our armor.
Everything adapts, predator or prey. Calamity may have found her niche.
What else does it say about her tactics?
Well... for some reason, she's recently taken to not being the first to fire.
But when she does, it's always a vital blow.
How did you know it said that?
We are dealing with an enemy that does not shoot but to kill. One with an uncanny sense of lethality. Like the tiger breaking a man's neck.
Which is how she shoots so seldom but kills so often... Good thinking, Nubian.
This will be a fine hunt, Qubtan. Are you up to it?
We'll have to be.
Of course you are! The Morganas have even come out to help us practice.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
What's that up there on the guardrail?
You're aware of Sedition, Qubtan?
Unfortunately.
Loathsome as our enemy is, I hate to discard their better tactics. Hence the pennant flying from our stern.
Sedition's?
She isn't in the area. I doubt there is any risk in using her as a trophy. Strike some fear into the hearts of other Morganas.
I didn't think Morganas felt fear.
Something tells me Cowardice will.

Fields.MenuText: I don't think she'll appreciate that assumption.
It's a shame others Morganas wouldn't respond similarly.
Something like... her name?

Fields.DialogueText: Fortunately, that doesn't bother me in the least.
Make an example of Cowardice, and maybe they'll consider it
Heh, yes, that was implied, Qubtan.
In any event, you are correct. We cannot rely on fear to fight the Morganas. That is their province.
And what's ours?
"No one who has an atom's weight of pride in his heart will enter the Garden." If there's one thing common to all Morganas, it is pride.
Catch them off guard by appealing to their vanity. I like it.
Precisely. Nothing blinds one like vanity. Conversely, those who suffer from it fight hardest to defend it.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Nubian, should Harun be out in this weather?
I remind you once again that he is a hunter, not some trophy parrot!
Right.
And even were he a parrot, he would be able to handle a little rain.
You mentioned a plan for him today.
I did! Animals and Morganas do not get along, yet Harun has not complained one whit.

Fields.MenuText: That might be because he can't speak.
He's a brave bird.
Which is more than I can say for some of the crew.

Fields.DialogueText: Then you must listen more closely.
As must we all be.
Remember what was said about mercy.
Now, he already trusts the two of us. We must trust him to hunt ever greater prey.
That seems an unnecessary risk. He can't fight the ships, and the Morganas themselves are just as invulnerable as you Belles.
When falconry declined in England, they said it was easier to train a gun than a bird.
So?
You can only fire a gun in one direction.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Looks like we're catching up to Calamity.
'Akhira. She's certainly adept at fleeing... but we are consummate pursuers.
You don't think she could be leading us into–
A trap? Of course she is. That is why we have Harun.
A falcon against who knows how many Morganas?
The Morganas we can handle. Calamity's specialty is upsetting that balance of power. She will strike at a critical moment... and that is when Harun will strike.
Calamity's brought friends. Harun had better strike quickly.
Patience. He will attack when the time is right.
@BATTLE
That ought to give Calamity something to think about.
We have just turned her primary tactic back on her. The world trembles at our cunning... but most of all, at the bravery of little Harun!
I saw him fly straight toward her. What did he do, anyway?
You were right, Qubtan. The Morganas cannot be wounded by mortal means. That does not mean they cannot be blinded.

Fields.MenuText: Harun's a bird. How can he possibly do any damage?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh.
Had you noticed that I fed him a little extra breakfast this morning?
Nubian, that's disgusting.
The Prophet said "War is deceit." Exploit blind spots and you may one day be blinded.
I'm sure he wasn't talking about this.
God leaves the details to the faithful.

Fields.MenuText: Go for the eyes, baby!

Fields.DialogueText: Not damage, as such.
Not quite an attack, but...

Fields.MenuText: Here's mud in your eye!

Fields.DialogueText: It wasn't mud.
Harun! Come back here!
Alssibr! You're going to agitate him.
He's already agitated.
I would be too if there were a Morgana on the horizon!
What!? How long has she been there?
Too long. Let's take care of her and her friends.
@BATTLE
Qubtan, I need another set of eyes on Harun.
Something wrong?
I weighed him this morning. He's not normally this heavy.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe it's all muscle.
He's been overeating?
What difference should that make?

Fields.DialogueText: I like your confidence, but do not confuse it with hubris.
Na'am, but I cannot believe that he has.
A heavy bird cannot fly nearly as well.
Perhaps my scales simply need recalibrating. I take extra care to feed him only when he is hungry, and he only brings kills back to me. I am the only surface for it.
You sound like you're trying to convince yourself.
I am only retracing my steps.
Here are some other Morganas. Is Harun ready?
After a fashion. I had a merry time waking him up this morning.
He likes his sleep, does he?
Pay more attention to him, Qubtan. He is not normally so... slothful!

Fields.MenuText: Maybe he just hasn't been in enough battles.

Fields.DialogueText: There is only so much being shot at can do. It turns good men into warriors and cowards into corpses.
Which is Harun?
He is an animal. This is at the heart of what worries me most.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Maybe he's getting fatigued from all his hunting.
It could be shell shock. A combat stress reaction.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't think activity would drain his stamina. He is made for activity, Qubtan.
Do you really think Harun is susceptible to that?
*ALARM*
Harun! Marhabaan bik fi albayt.
What did we find out?
I've worked out a system, Qubtan. Judging by the airspeed of an unladen falcon, I may determine where the nearest Morganas are located.
You mean those Morganas right there?
Madha!? They're not supposed to be anywhere near us!
Apparently nobody's told them. Action stations.
@BATTLE
There is something to be said for the thrill of the hunt... but I do not wish to repeat that encounter.

Fields.MenuText: I thought you'd worked out a system.
Are you all right?
I just want to know how they slipped the perimeter.

Fields.DialogueText: As did I, Qubtan! I have full faith in Harun's skill.
More than all right, Qubtan. I am annoyed.
Morganas have ways around our senses, it seems.
Seems our fine feathered friend hasn't been earning his keep.
Do not be so harsh, Qubtan. I am sure–
Harun! Eud 'iilaa hna!
Where the hell is he going?
Where does not concern me. Why is he going?
(Harun flies off suddenly...)
You've been reclusive lately.
I have been thinking.
You're always thinking.
And always acting. This is one time I am powerless to act on my thoughts.
It's Harun, isn't it?
I have been over this problem from every possible perspective, Qubtan. I kept tight control of his meals, his hunts, his habits... when did he slip my gaze?

Fields.MenuText: When he flew away.
It can't just be you. Something had to have bothered him.
Who knows? He's just an animal.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad someone's keeping their sense of humor intact.
That's exactly what I can't help but dwell on.
Aren't we all? It is how we deal with our circumstances that determines what we are.
We have Morganas inbound. Worry about Harun later.
Wait... Qubtan, do you see that?
What?
Look there on the prow of those Morganas and tell me I am wrong or insane.
Looks like a stuffed... Harun?
Alssahirat.
@BATTLE
How could I have missed it?
You couldn't have known.
I could have, but for my accursed pride! To think I was the only surface on the sea Harun would take his kills to dine...
No wonder those Morganas kept tailing us.
When a falcon is fed up – allowed to eat its fill – you have lost control of him. Then he is gone, and the hunter has only herself to blame.

Fields.MenuText: I warned you about letting him out of your sight.
If you want to blame anyone, blame the Morganas.
We'll find another just like him.

Fields.DialogueText: "Pride means to renounce the truth..."
They may have acted, but they acted on an opportunity.
That would only be treating a symptom.
Well, mourning won't bring him back.
It will not... but perhaps he can be brought back anyway.
What?
Qubtan, which Morgana was it that claimed Harun?
Calamity, I think.
I might have known. We must take one more trophy from her, it seems.
She's not among the group we're up against today.
Then let them warn her. The pursuit will be all the sweeter for the challenge.
@BATTLE
Let's start hunting!
*BANG*
Shooting practice?
One of the French Belles says it calms the nerves. I am not sure I disagree.

Fields.MenuText: You're still thinking about Harun?
How's your aim?
Is this the same one who throws men overboard?

Fields.DialogueText: And how I might have done right by him.
That is not the point of the exercise... but it is impeccable.
I told you that was a rumor. But broken clocks, and all that...
Even the prey gets the upper hand from time to time. That's just how predators adapt.
My skill as a hunter is not in question. But I did allow my pride in it to blind me to possible setbacks. That is what felled Calamity the first time.
We all make mistakes.
Not every mistake sends one of God's creatures to its death.
I'm the captain. I live with that fear every day. You're a ship – you should know. At least you're equipped with lifeboats.
You know, Belles don't disobey direct orders. I'm sure you could just tell me not to stay mad at myself.
It wouldn't be terribly helpful.
Nor would it be as fun. I am glad I chose you.
That makes two of us.
Those Morganas look familiar. Shall we pick up where we left off last engagement?
@BATTLE
Nubian, Morganas! Where the hell are you?
Coming, Qubtan! There were just some things I needed to attend to.
Why do you smell like...
Things related to dinner?
We talked about this before. No cooking on the battlefield.
Hadi nafsik. I have read the dossiers on the nearby Morganas, and they will be no threat to us.

Fields.MenuText: Isn't that kind of pride what lost us Harun?
I hope the food's good, at any rate.
I trust you if you're as thorough as you say you are.

Fields.DialogueText: There is a difference between pride and preparation.
It ought to wash out the taste after we devour these Morganas.
Never read anything just once, that's what I say.
Once I might have underestimated our enemy. From this day forward, I vow only to find them wanting.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
You're going to enjoy today's assignment.
All too much, Qubtan. I understand Calamity has been spotted in these waters.
With her usual backup. But unless the Morganas have a flotilla of submarines about, she's done for.
It is a joy and yet a puzzle. Why expose herself in such a way?

Fields.MenuText: She's right there. It would be criminal not to take this opportunity.
Shall we wait and see what she does?
Maybe she wants to talk.

Fields.DialogueText: Even a criminal may be correct.
That is precisely what Calamity would want from us... and yet she must know that we know that.
The proper way to speak to your prey is from the top of a pit dug to ensnare them.
While we're at it, I think–
*BOOM*
‘Asfl!
I thought she never shot first?
She rarely shoots first. Something tells me she does not take us seriously...
@BATTLE
Her mistake, Nubian. Let's go!
What's in the box?
The usual trophy. This one is from Calamity.
What did we find this time?
She... gave this one to me.
Gave it to you? How?
She floated it over on a lifeboat during the battle. Did you know Morganas have lifeboats?

Fields.MenuText: I doubt their crews are given the chance to make use of them.
What did you do with the lifeboat?
Nubian, it could be dangerous!

Fields.DialogueText: You're correct on that point, I'm sure.
I sent it back full of thermite and gunpowder. She'd do the same for me.
It is no longer any danger to us, I assure you.
This box contains a stuffed falcon and nothing more.
A bit of Morgana humour. Were we to keep him, she could easily find us again, as with any other trophy.
That rotten...
Irony is one of the deadliest weapons, Qubtan. Infinitely adaptable and never obsolete. Yet it is also the most easily parried.
Just by not letting it get to you?
Harun fed us and fought for us. Even in death he will teach us.
Teach us what?
Play your cards right and your enemy will make beautiful decorations for your end table.
That's a little morbid.
So is war. I choose to see the lighter side. The Morganas have monopolized gloom.
Here are a few more. Think they'll help decorate?
You need not ask the deer how it likes your lounge.
@BATTLE
Harun? I'm sorry, Nubian. Why did she give him back to us?
At long last! Qubtan, you must join us all for dinner tonight.
Finally got enough seagull meat for a feast?
They are skinny birds, but what is a big thing but a hundred small things?
I suppose we have Harun to thank for our dinner as well?
He has a permanent place in Command's archives now. It is the least I can do for such a noble beast.

Fields.MenuText: There will be other falcons.
Will you want him back once it's all over?
Noble... or just hungry.

Fields.DialogueText: Perhaps, but only one may be the first.
I will let him rest. His life was long enough.
Everyone is hungry, Qubtan.
I'd give anything just to see another falcon take on Calamity.
Maybe one day, Qubtan. Let his master do her work for now.
Just remember that the captain goes down with her.
My, my, Qubtan, you steep your tongue in honey! I would not ask you to throw the world away for me. If you may yet do good works without me, by all means, do so.
The world will have one fewer huntress on its front lines.
The world will get by. This huntress is in good company. Let us hunt.
I hope you have an appetite, Qubtan! It is nearly time for-
For a Morgana interruption, Nubian. Tell the cooks to put it back in the oven until we're done.
Let's end this quickly!
@BATTLE
